title: Letters: How has the pandemic affected children's social skills?
description: 'Pro-life' is 'anti-life' toward women. How are children faring after pandemic isolation? Gun violence rages while city talks pay hikes.

Letters: 'Don't like abortions? Don't get one.' Saving babies doesn't equal killing moms.
'JoAnns' of the future threatened 
Gun violence 'solution' is pay raises?
text: Letters: How has the pandemic affected children's social skills?News Sports Entertainment Business Opinion Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals  LETTERSLetters: 'Don't like abortions? Don't get one.' Saving babies doesn't equal killing moms.Letters to the Editor'JoAnns' of the future threatened I am 74 years old. I came of age shortly before the Roe v. Wade decision, and was ever so relieved. Now I hear anti-choice people referring to themselves as pro-life. One of the things this misnomer can lead to clearly is anti-life.Way before Roe v. Wade, my father’s secretary, a wonderful woman named JoAnn, suffered horrible pain for a few weeks until she finally went to the emergency room.She was told that had she not gone to the ER that night, she would not have seen the light of the following day.  More:Overturning Roe v Wade would take away equal protection for womenThe diagnosis? Ectopic pregnancy, which can never be carried to term.Either the pregnancy is ended or the mother dies; the fetus dies either way. Back then, no one gave a second thought to saving JoAnn’s life, and she lived to old age.Today, some states are passing laws against even this, since it is technically an abortion.Is this what anti-choice people really want? You are going down the road of killing the JoAnns of the future even when there is no way to save the babies. Please stop this insanity.  Opinion:If abortion is banned in Ohio, seekers would have to drive 157 to 269 milesJoAnn’s story is only one of the multitude of ways that potential mothers die (and take their fetuses with them) when Draconian laws prevent them from ending ectopic pregnancies or lead them to back-alley abortions for other reasons. If you think killing mothers equals saving babies, please think again.Don’t like abortions? Don’t get one. Offer help to women who would like to carry their babies to term but can’t see their way clear to do it. But please, stop pushing for and passing laws that get them killed.Susan H. (Sue) Robinson, NewarkShare your thoughts:How to submit a letter to the editor for The Columbus DispatchSign Up for the Columbus Conversation Newsletter Join the Columbus Dispatch Conversation Facebook group RSVP to attend our next Columbus Conversation virtual town hall How to submit a letter to the editor for The Columbus DispatchGun violence 'solution' is pay raises?  From the April 25 article, "Strategies shifting to fight gun violence": "In Columbus, gun violence raged in 2020 and 2021, culminating in two consecutive years of record homicide figures in the city and leaving city leaders searching for solutions."More:Panel appointed by Columbus elected officials recommends boosting those officials' payWhat did they come up with? Forty percent raises for the hard-working city leaders and a guaranteed four more years of Mayor Andrew Ginther leading the way. That will show 'em.Miles C.
